abstract: New York State Supreme Court awards $183 million in damages to five firefighters killed or injured while battling 2005 blaze in Bronx; family of sixth firefighter settled out of court; $140 million will be paid by city, with remainder paid by one of building's former owners.
lead_paragraph: A State Supreme Court jury awarded the amount to five firefighters who battled a deadly Bronx fire and their families for damages from the city and the building’s owner.

headline.main: Jury Awards New York Firefighters $183 Million in 2005 Blaze
headline.print_headline: Jury Awards Firefighters $183 Million in ’05 Blaze

snippet: A State Supreme Court jury awarded the amount to five firefighters who battled a deadly Bronx fire and their families for damages from the city and the building’s owner.
